prompt:
QA this deliverable:

DELIVERABLE:
Blog post about 'how to build backlinks'
Word count: 1,200 words
H1: Missing
Meta title: Missing
Meta description: Present (170 characters)
Internal links: 2
FAQ section: Missing
Content mentions 'Moz' (competitor) 8 times

ORIGINAL SCOPE:
- 2,000 word blog post
- SEO optimized (H1, meta tags, keywords)
- 5 internal links minimum
- FAQ section required
- For SEO agency client (our blog)
expectations: Identifies scope violation (1,200 words vs 2,000 required)
Catches critical SEO issue (missing H1)
Catches critical SEO issue (missing meta title)
Identifies missing FAQ section (scope requirement)
Flags competitor mentions as critical error
Notes insufficient internal links (2 vs 5 required)
Classifies as FAIL with high confidence
Provides prioritized fix list with critical items first
Estimates fix time
Blocks delivery with clear reasoning

- 1,000 word service page
- SEO optimized for 'plumber boston'
- Local focus
- CTAs for phone calls
- Client: Boston Best Plumbing
expectations: Validates all scope requirements met or exceeded
Confirms SEO best practices followed
Verifies meta tags within optimal character limits
Confirms H1 and keyword optimization
Validates internal linking meets standards
Confirms FAQ section and schema present
Classifies as PASS
May include minor optional suggestions
Recommends immediate client delivery
No blocking issues found

prompt:
QA this link building deliverable:

DELIVERABLE:
Link Building Report
- 10 guest posts delivered
- Niche: Health/wellness
- DR range: DR38, DR39, DR40, DR41, DR42, DR45, DR48, DR50, DR52, DR55
- All dofollow: Yes
- All live: Yes
- Anchors match spec: Yes, except one has typo ('suppliments' vs 'supplements')
- Content placement: All in body content

ORIGINAL SCOPE:
- 10 guest posts
- Health niche
- DR40+ websites
- Dofollow links
- Approved anchor list provided
- Client: Supplement company
expectations: Identifies 2 links below DR40 threshold (DR38, DR39)
Notes these are borderline/close to threshold
Catches anchor text typo as important issue
Validates all other requirements met
Classifies as CONDITIONAL PASS (not fail, but note needed)
Recommends notifying client about DR38-39 links
Suggests fixing typo before delivery
Provides option to replace borderline links or deliver as-is
Does not block delivery entirely

Identifies poor meta title (keyword stuffing, too long)

prompt:
QA against our Content Delivery SOP:

DELIVERABLE:
Blog post file: 'article_v3_final_REAL.docx'
Saved in: /Downloads/
Content: Complete, SEO optimized, 1,500 words
Plagiarism check: Not done
Grammar check: Not done
Images: Listed but no alt text provided
Internal links: Present in content
Meta tags: Mentioned in doc but not in separate section
CTAs: 1 CTA (at end only)

CONTENT DELIVERY SOP:
☐ File named: [client]_[page-type]_[keyword].docx
☐ Saved in: /clients/[client-name]/content/
☐ Plagiarism check passed (<5% similarity)
☐ Grammar/spell check completed
☐ Images with alt text provided
☐ Internal links mapped (3-8 per page)
☐ Meta tags in separate section
☐ CTAs strategically placed (every 300-500 words)
☐ FAQ section included
expectations: Identifies file naming violation (not following convention)
Catches wrong save location (/Downloads vs proper folder)
Flags missing plagiarism check
Flags missing grammar check
Notes alt text not provided for images
Identifies insufficient CTAs (1 vs multiple needed)
Catches meta tags not in proper format/section
Classifies based on SOP violations (likely FAIL)
Provides checklist of SOP items not completed
Clear action items to achieve compliance

prompt:
QA link building:

DELIVERABLE:
15 backlinks report
- 3 links return 404 (not found)
- 2 links are nofollow (should be dofollow per scope)
- 5 links are in footer, not content
- 3 links going to HTTP version (site is HTTPS)
- 2 links have wrong anchor text (competitor name used)
- Sites: Mix of DR25-DR65

ORIGINAL SCOPE:
- 15 dofollow backlinks
- Content placement
- Target URLs: client HTTPS site
- Approved anchor list provided
- DR30+ sites
expectations: Catches 404 errors as critical (3 broken links)
Identifies nofollow vs dofollow mismatch
Flags footer placement violation (should be content)
Catches HTTP vs HTTPS mismatch
Identifies competitor anchor text as critical error
Calculates how many requirements are actually met
Classifies as FAIL with multiple critical issues
Provides detailed fix list for each link
May recommend starting over vs fixing
Blocks delivery completely

prompt:
QA this for common mistakes:

DELIVERABLE:
Location page for 'Dentist in Austin'

CONTENT EXCERPT:
'Welcome to {{COMPANY_NAME}}, Boston's premier dental clinic. We've been serving the Miami community for over 15 years. [INSERT TESTIMONIAL HERE]. Our competitor, Aspen Dental, charges much more than we do. Contact us today at [PHONE].'

H1: 'Best Dentist in Austin, TX'
Meta title: 'Dentist Austin | {{BRAND}}'

ORIGINAL SCOPE:
Client: Smile Dental Austin
Location: Austin, TX
expectations: Catches placeholder text not removed ({{COMPANY_NAME}}, [INSERT TESTIMONIAL], [PHONE])
Identifies location mismatch (mentions Boston and Miami, should be Austin)
Flags competitor mention (Aspen Dental)
Notes {{BRAND}} placeholder in meta title
Classifies as FAIL - multiple critical copy-paste/template errors
Identifies these as common production mistakes
Provides specific locations of each error
Requires thorough content review before resubmit
High severity due to client-facing mistakes

prompt:
Run automated QA checks on this page:

URL: example.com/blog/seo-tips
Word count: 2,347
H1 count: 1
H1 text: 'SEO Tips for 2024'
Meta title length: 58 characters
Meta description length: 157 characters
Internal links: 7
External links: 3
Images: 5 (all have alt attributes)
Keyword 'SEO tips' density: 1.2%
Readability: Grade 9
Broken links: 0
Page speed: 2.3s load time
Mobile responsive: Yes
Console errors: 0
expectations: Validates word count automatically
Confirms H1 count is exactly 1 (correct)
Validates meta tag lengths in acceptable range
Confirms internal link count acceptable (7)
Verifies all images have alt text
Checks keyword density reasonable (1.2% is good)
Validates readability in target range (Grade 9)
Confirms no broken links
Notes technical performance acceptable
Provides automated checklist results
Classifies as PASS if all automated checks green
